00076 static char * lcfg_devname;
00077 
00078 int lcfg_set_devname(char *name)
00079 {
00080         char *ptr;
00081         int digit = 1;
00082 
00083         if (name) {
00084                 if (lcfg_devname)
00085                         free(lcfg_devname);
00086                 /* quietly strip the unnecessary '$' */
00087                 if (*name == '$' || *name == '%')
00088                         name++;
00089 
00090                 ptr = name;
00091                 while (*ptr != '\0') {
00092                         if (!isdigit(*ptr)) {
00093                             digit = 0;
00094                             break;
00095                         }
00096                         ptr++;
00097                 }
00098 
00099                 if (digit) {
00100                         /* We can't translate from dev # to name */
00101                         lcfg_devname = NULL;
00102                 } else {
00103                         lcfg_devname = strdup(name);
00104                 }
00105         } else {
00106                 lcfg_devname = NULL;
00107         }
00108         return 0;
00109 }
00110 
00111 char * lcfg_get_devname(void)
00112 {
00113         return lcfg_devname;
00114 }

00120 
00121 int jt_lcfg_attach(int argc, char **argv)
00122 {
00123         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00124         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00125         int rc;
00126 
00127         if (argc != 4)
00128                 return CMD_HELP;
00129 
00130         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, NULL);
00131 
00132         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, argv[1]);
00133         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 0, argv[2]);
00134         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 2, argv[3]);
00135 
00136         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_ATTACH, &bufs);
00137         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00138                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00139         } else {
00140                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00141                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00142         }
00143         if (rc < 0) {
00144                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: LCFG_ATTACH %s\n",
00145                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(rc = errno));
00146         } else {
00147                 lcfg_set_devname(argv[2]);
00148         }
00149 
00150         return rc;
00151 }
00152 
00153 int jt_lcfg_setup(int argc, char **argv)
00154 {
00155         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00156         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00157         int i;
00158         int rc;
00159 
00160         if (lcfg_devname == NULL) {
00161                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: please use 'device name' to set the "
00162                         "device name for config commands.\n",
00163                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
00164                 return -EINVAL;
00165         }
00166 
00167         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, lcfg_devname);
00168 
00169         if (argc > 6)
00170                 return CMD_HELP;
00171 
00172         for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00173                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, i, argv[i]);
00174         }
00175 
00176         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_SETUP, &bufs);
00177         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00178                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00179         } else {
00180                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00181                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00182         }
00183         if (rc < 0)
00184                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00185                         strerror(rc = errno));
00186 
00187         return rc;
00188 }

00191 {
00192         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00193         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00194         int rc;
00195 
00196         if (lcfg_devname == NULL) {
00197                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: please use 'device name' to set the "
00198                         "device name for config commands.\n",
00199                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
00200                 return -EINVAL;
00201         }
00202 
00203         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, lcfg_devname);
00204 
00205         if (argc != 1)
00206                 return CMD_HELP;
00207 
00208         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_DETACH, &bufs);
00209         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00210                 rc = -ENOMEM;

00213                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00214         }
00215         if (rc < 0)
00216                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00217                         strerror(rc = errno));
00218 
00219         return rc;
00220 }
00221 
00222 int jt_obd_cleanup(int argc, char **argv)
00223 {
00224         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00225         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00226         char force = 'F';
00227         char failover = 'A';
00228         char flags[3] = { 0 };
00229         int flag_cnt = 0, n;
00230         int rc;
00231 
00232         if (lcfg_devname == NULL) {
00233                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: please use 'device name' to set the "
00234                         "device name for config commands.\n",
00235                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
00236                 return -EINVAL;
00237         }
00238 
00239         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, lcfg_devname);
00240 
00241         if (argc < 1 || argc > 3)
00242                 return CMD_HELP;
00243 
00244         /* we are protected from overflowing our buffer by the argc
00245          * check above
00246          */
00247         for (n = 1; n < argc; n++) {
00248                 if (strcmp(argv[n], "force") == 0) {
00249                         flags[flag_cnt++] = force;
00250                 } else if (strcmp(argv[n], "failover") == 0) {
00251                         flags[flag_cnt++] = failover;
00252                 } else {
00253                         fprintf(stderr, "unknown option: %s\n", argv[n]);
00254                         return CMD_HELP;
00255                 }
00256         }
00257 
00258         if (flag_cnt) {
00259                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, flags);
00260         }
00261 
00262         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_CLEANUP, &bufs);
00263         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00264                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00265         } else {
00266                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00267                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00268         }
00269         if (rc < 0)
00270                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00271                         strerror(rc = errno));
00272 
00273         return rc;
00274 }
00275 
00276 static
00277 int do_add_uuid(char * func, char *uuid, lnet_nid_t nid)
00278 {
00279         int rc;
00280         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00281         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00282 
00283         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, lcfg_devname);
00284         if (uuid != NULL)
00285                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, uuid);
00286 
00287         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_ADD_UUID, &bufs);
00288         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00289                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00290         } else {
00291                 lcfg->lcfg_nid = nid;
00292 
00293                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(func, OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00294                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00295         }
00296         if (rc) {
00297                 fprintf(stderr, "IOC_PORTAL_ADD_UUID failed: %s\n",
00298                         strerror(errno));
00299                 return -1;
00300         }
00301 
00302         if (uuid != NULL)
00303                 printf("Added uuid %s: %s\n", uuid, libcfs_nid2str(nid));
00304 
00305         return 0;
00306 }
00307 
00308 int jt_lcfg_add_uuid(int argc, char **argv)
00309 {
00310         lnet_nid_t nid;
00311 
00312         if (argc != 3) {
00313                 return CMD_HELP;
00314         }
00315 
00316         nid = libcfs_str2nid(argv[2]);
00317         if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00318                 fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse NID %s\n", argv[2]);
00319                 return (-1);
00320         }
00321 
00322         return do_add_uuid(argv[0], argv[1], nid);
00323 }
00324 
00325 int jt_lcfg_del_uuid(int argc, char **argv)
00326 {
00327         int rc;
00328         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00329         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00330 
00331         if (argc != 2) {
00332                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <uuid>\n", argv[0]);
00333                 return 0;
00334         }
00335 
00336         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, lcfg_devname);
00337         if (strcmp (argv[1], "_all_"))
00338                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, argv[1]);
00339 
00340         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_DEL_UUID, &bufs);
00341         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00342                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00343         } else {
00344                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00345                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00346         }
00347         if (rc) {
00348                 fprintf(stderr, "IOC_PORTAL_DEL_UUID failed: %s\n",
00349                         strerror(errno));
00350                 return -1;
00351         }
00352         return 0;
00353 }

00355 int jt_lcfg_del_mount_option(int argc, char **argv)
00356 {
00357         int rc;
00358         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00359         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00360 
00361         if (argc != 2)
00362                 return CMD_HELP;
00363 
00364         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, lcfg_devname);
00365 
00366         /* profile name */
00367         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, argv[1]);
00368 
00369         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_DEL_MOUNTOPT, &bufs);
00370         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00371                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00372         } else {
00373                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00374                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00375         }
00376         if (rc < 0) {
00377                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00378                         strerror(rc = errno));
00379         }
00380         return rc;
00381 }

00383 int jt_lcfg_set_timeout(int argc, char **argv)
00384 {
00385         int rc;
00386         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00387         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00388 
00389         fprintf(stderr, "%s has been deprecated. Use conf_param instead.\n"
00390                 "e.g. conf_param lustre-MDT0000 obd_timeout=50\n",
00391                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
00392         return CMD_HELP;
00393 
00394 
00395         if (argc != 2)
00396                 return CMD_HELP;
00397 
00398         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, lcfg_devname);
00399         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_SET_TIMEOUT, &bufs);
00400         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00401                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00402         } else {
00403                 lcfg->lcfg_num = atoi(argv[1]);
00404 
00405                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00406                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00407         }
00408         if (rc < 0) {
00409                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00410                         strerror(rc = errno));
00411         }
00412         return rc;
00413 }

00415 int jt_lcfg_add_conn(int argc, char **argv)
00416 {
00417         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00418         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00419         int priority;
00420         int rc;
00421 
00422         if (argc == 2)
00423                 priority = 0;
00424         else if (argc == 3)
00425                 priority = 1;
00426         else
00427                 return CMD_HELP;
00428 
00429         if (lcfg_devname == NULL) {
00430                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: please use 'device name' to set the "
00431                         "device name for config commands.\n",
00432                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
00433                 return -EINVAL;
00434         }
00435 
00436         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, lcfg_devname);
00437 
00438         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, argv[1]);
00439 
00440         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_ADD_CONN, &bufs);
00441         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00442                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00443         } else {
00444                 lcfg->lcfg_num = priority;
00445 
00446                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00447                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00448         }
00449         if (rc < 0) {
00450                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00451                         strerror(rc = errno));
00452         }
00453 
00454         return rc;
00455 }

00457 int jt_lcfg_del_conn(int argc, char **argv)
00458 {
00459         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;

00461         int rc;
00462 
00463         if (argc != 2)
00464                 return CMD_HELP;

00467                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: please use 'device name' to set the "

00469                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
00470                 return -EINVAL;
00471         }
00472 
00473         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, lcfg_devname);
00474 
00475         /* connection uuid */
00476         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, argv[1]);
00477 
00478         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_DEL_MOUNTOPT, &bufs);
00479         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00480                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00481         } else {
00482                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00483                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00484         }
00485         if (rc < 0) {
00486                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00487                         strerror(rc = errno));
00488         }
00489 
00490         return rc;
00491 }

00493 /* Param set locally, directly on target */
00494 int jt_lcfg_param(int argc, char **argv)
00495 {
00496         int i, rc;
00497         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00498         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00499 
00500         if (argc >= LUSTRE_CFG_MAX_BUFCOUNT)
00501                 return CMD_HELP;
00502 
00503         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, NULL);
00504 
00505         for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00506                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, i, argv[i]);
00507         }
00508 
00509         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_PARAM, &bufs);
00510         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00511                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00512         } else {
00513                 rc = lcfg_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00514                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00515         }
00516         if (rc < 0) {
00517                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00518                         strerror(rc = errno));
00519         }
00520         return rc;
00521 }
00522 
00523 struct param_opts {
00524         unsigned int po_only_path:1;
00525         unsigned int po_show_path:1;
00526         unsigned int po_show_type:1;
00527         unsigned int po_recursive:1;
00528         unsigned int po_params2:1;
00529         unsigned int po_delete:1;
00530         unsigned int po_only_dir:1;
00531 };
00532 
00533 /* Param set to single log file, used by all clients and servers.
00534  * This should be loaded after the individual config logs.
00535  * Called from set param with -P option.
00536  */
00537 static int jt_lcfg_mgsparam2(int argc, char **argv, struct param_opts *popt)
00538 {
00539         int     rc, i;
00540         int     first_param;
00541         struct  lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00542         struct  lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00543         char    *buf = NULL;
00544         int     len;
00545 
00546         first_param = optind;
00547         if (first_param < 0 || first_param >= argc)
00548                 return CMD_HELP;
00549 
00550         for (i = first_param, rc = 0; i < argc; i++) {
00551                 lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, NULL);
00552                 /* This same command would be executed on all nodes, many
00553                  * of which should fail (silently) because they don't have
00554                  * that proc file existing locally. There would be no
00555                  * preprocessing on the MGS to try to figure out which
00556                  * parameter files to add this to, there would be nodes
00557                  * processing on the cluster nodes to try to figure out
00558                  * if they are the intended targets. They will blindly
00559                  * try to set the parameter, and ENOTFOUND means it wasn't
00560                  * for them.
00561                  * Target name "general" means call on all targets. It is
00562                  * left here in case some filtering will be added in
00563                  * future.
00564                  */
00565                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 0, "general");
00566 
00567                 len = strlen(argv[i]);
00568 
00569                 /* put an '=' on the end in case it doesn't have one */
00570                 if (popt->po_delete && argv[i][len - 1] != '=') {
00571                         buf = malloc(len + 1);
00572                         if (buf == NULL) {
00573                                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00574                                 break;
00575                         }
00576                         sprintf(buf, "%s=", argv[i]);
00577                 } else {
00578                         buf = argv[i];
00579                 }
00580                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, buf);
00581 
00582                 lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_SET_PARAM, &bufs);
00583                 if (lcfg == NULL) {
00584                         fprintf(stderr, "error: allocating lcfg for %s: %s\n",
00585                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(-ENOMEM));
00586                         if (rc == 0)
00587                                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00588                 } else {
00589                         int rc2 = lcfg_mgs_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00590                         if (rc2 != 0) {
00591                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: executing %s: %s\n",
00592                                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(errno));
00593                                 if (rc == 0)
00594                                         rc = rc2;
00595                         }
00596                         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00597                 }
00598                 if (buf != argv[i])
00599                         free(buf);
00600         }
00601 
00602         return rc;
00603 }
00604 
00605 /* Param set in config log on MGS */
00606 /* conf_param key=value */
00607 /* Note we can actually send mgc conf_params from clients, but currently
00608  * that's only done for default file striping (see ll_send_mgc_param),
00609  * and not here. */
00610 /* After removal of a parameter (-d) Lustre will use the default
00611  * AT NEXT REBOOT, not immediately. */
00612 int jt_lcfg_mgsparam(int argc, char **argv)
00613 {
00614         int rc;
00615         int del = 0;
00616         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00617         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00618         char *buf = NULL;
00619 
00620 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE >= OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 8, 53, 0)
00621         fprintf(stderr, "warning: 'lctl conf_param' is deprecated, "
00622                 "use 'lctl set_param -P' instead\n");
00623 #endif
00624 
00625         /* mgs_setparam processes only lctl buf #1 */
00626         if ((argc > 3) || (argc <= 1))
00627                 return CMD_HELP;
00628 
00629         while ((rc = getopt(argc, argv, "d")) != -1) {
00630                 switch (rc) {
00631                         case 'd':
00632                                 del = 1;
00633                                 break;
00634                         default:
00635                                 return CMD_HELP;
00636                 }
00637         }
00638 
00639         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, NULL);
00640         if (del) {
00641                 char *ptr;
00642 
00643                 /* for delete, make it "<param>=\0" */
00644                 buf = malloc(strlen(argv[optind]) + 2);
00645                 if (buf == NULL) {
00646                         rc = -ENOMEM;
00647                         goto out;
00648                 }
00649                 /* put an '=' on the end in case it doesn't have one */
00650                 sprintf(buf, "%s=", argv[optind]);
00651                 /* then truncate after the first '=' */
00652                 ptr = strchr(buf, '=');
00653                 *(++ptr) = '\0';
00654                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, buf);
00655         } else {
00656                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, argv[optind]);
00657         }
00658 
00659         /* We could put other opcodes here. */
00660         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_PARAM, &bufs);
00661         if (lcfg == NULL) {
00662                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00663         } else {
00664                 rc = lcfg_mgs_ioctl(argv[0], OBD_DEV_ID, lcfg);
00665                 if (rc < 0)
00666                         rc = -errno;
00667                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00668         }
00669         if (buf)
00670                 free(buf);
00671 out:
00672         if (rc < 0) {
00673                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00674                         strerror(-rc));
00675         }
00676 
00677         return rc;
00678 }
00679 
00690 static char *
00691 display_name(const char *filename, struct stat *st, struct param_opts *popt)
00692 {
00693         size_t suffix_len = 0;
00694         char *suffix = NULL;
00695         char *param_name;
00696         char *tmp;
00697 
00698         if (popt->po_show_type) {
00699                 if (S_ISDIR(st->st_mode))
00700                         suffix = "/";
00701                 else if (S_ISLNK(st->st_mode))
00702                         suffix = "@";
00703                 else if (st->st_mode & S_IWUSR)
00704                         suffix = "=";
00705         }
00706 
00707         /* Take the original filename string and chop off the glob addition */
00708         tmp = strstr(filename, "/lustre/");
00709         if (tmp == NULL) {
00710                 tmp = strstr(filename, "/lnet/");
00711                 if (tmp != NULL)
00712                         tmp += strlen("/lnet/");
00713         } else {
00714                 tmp += strlen("/lustre/");
00715         }
00716 
00717         /* Allocate return string */
00718         param_name = strdup(tmp);
00719         if (param_name == NULL)
00720                 return NULL;
00721 
00722         /* replace '/' with '.' to match conf_param and sysctl */
00723         for (tmp = strchr(param_name, '/'); tmp != NULL; tmp = strchr(tmp, '/'))
00724                 *tmp = '.';
00725 
00726         /* Append the indicator to entries if needed. */
00727         if (popt->po_show_type && suffix != NULL) {
00728                 suffix_len = strlen(suffix);
00729 
00730                 tmp = realloc(param_name, suffix_len + strlen(param_name) + 1);
00731                 if (tmp != NULL) {
00732                         param_name = tmp;
00733                         strncat(param_name, suffix, suffix_len);
00734                 }
00735         }
00736 
00737         return param_name;
00738 }
00739 
00740 /* Find a character in a length limited string */
00741 /* BEWARE - kernel definition of strnchr has args in different order! */
00742 static char *strnchr(const char *p, char c, size_t n)
00743 {
00744        if (!p)
00745                return (0);
00746 
00747        while (n-- > 0) {
00748                if (*p == c)
00749                        return ((char *)p);
00750                p++;
00751        }
00752        return (0);
00753 }
00754 
00767 static int
00768 clean_path(struct param_opts *popt, char *path)
00769 {
00770         char *nidstr = NULL;
00771         char *tmp;
00772 
00773         if (popt == NULL || path == NULL || strlen(path) == 0)
00774                 return -EINVAL;
00775 
00776         /* If path contains a suffix we need to remove it */
00777         if (popt->po_show_type) {
00778                 size_t path_end = strlen(path) - 1;
00779 
00780                 tmp = path + path_end;
00781                 switch (*tmp) {
00782                 case '@':
00783                 case '=':
00784                 case '/':
00785                         *tmp = '\0';
00786                 default:
00787                         break;
00788                 }
00789         }
00790 
00791         /* get rid of '\', glob doesn't like it */
00792         tmp = strrchr(path, '\\');
00793         if (tmp != NULL) {
00794                 char *tail = path + strlen(path);
00795 
00796                 while (tmp != path) {
00797                         if (*tmp == '\\') {
00798                                 memmove(tmp, tmp + 1, tail - tmp);
00799                                 --tail;
00800                         }
00801                         --tmp;
00802                 }
00803         }
00804 
00805         /* Does this path contain a NID string ? */
00806         tmp = strchr(path, '@');
00807         if (tmp != NULL) {
00808                 char *find_nid = strdup(path);
00809                 lnet_nid_t nid;
00810 
00811                 if (find_nid == NULL)
00812                         return -ENOMEM;
00813 
00814                 /* First we need to chop off rest after nid string.
00815                  * Since find_nid is a clone of path it better have
00816                  * '@' */
00817                 tmp = strchr(find_nid, '@');
00818                 tmp = strchr(tmp, '.');
00819                 if (tmp != NULL)
00820                         *tmp = '\0';
00821 
00822                 /* Now chop off the front. */
00823                 for (tmp = strchr(find_nid, '.'); tmp != NULL;
00824                      tmp = strchr(tmp, '.')) {
00825                         /* Remove MGC to make it NID format */
00826                         if (!strncmp(++tmp, "MGC", 3))
00827                                 tmp += 3;
00828 
00829                         nid = libcfs_str2nid(tmp);
00830                         if (nid != LNET_NID_ANY) {
00831                                 nidstr = libcfs_nid2str(nid);
00832                                 if (nidstr == NULL)
00833                                         return -EINVAL;
00834                                 break;
00835                         }
00836                 }
00837                 free(find_nid);
00838         }
00839 
00840         /* replace param '.' with '/' */
00841         for (tmp = strchr(path, '.'); tmp != NULL; tmp = strchr(tmp, '.')) {
00842                 *tmp++ = '/';
00843 
00844                 /* Remove MGC to make it NID format */
00845                 if (!strncmp(tmp, "MGC", 3))
00846                         tmp += 3;
00847 
00848                 /* There exist cases where some of the subdirectories of the
00849                  * the parameter tree has embedded in its name a NID string.
00850                  * This means that it is possible that these subdirectories
00851                  * could have actual '.' in its name. If this is the case we
00852                  * don't want to blindly replace the '.' with '/'. */
00853                 if (nidstr != NULL) {
00854                         char *match = strstr(tmp, nidstr);
00855 
00856                         if (tmp == match)
00857                                 tmp += strlen(nidstr);
00858                 }
00859         }
00860 
00861         return 0;
00862 }
00863 
00872 enum parameter_operation {
00873         LIST_PARAM,
00874         GET_PARAM,
00875         SET_PARAM,
00876 };
00877 
00878 char *parameter_opname[] = {
00879         [LIST_PARAM] = "list_param",
00880         [GET_PARAM] = "get_param",
00881         [SET_PARAM] = "set_param",
00882 };
00883 
00895 static int
00896 read_param(const char *path, const char *param_name, struct param_opts *popt)
00897 {
00898         bool display_path = popt->po_show_path;
00899         long page_size = sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE);
00900         int rc = 0;
00901         char *buf;
00902         int fd;
00903 
00904         /* Read the contents of file to stdout */
00905         fd = open(path, O_RDONLY);
00906         if (fd < 0) {
00907                 rc = -errno;
00908                 fprintf(stderr,
00909                         "error: get_param: opening '%s': %s\n",
00910                         path, strerror(errno));
00911                 return rc;
00912         }
00913 
00914         buf = calloc(1, page_size);
00915         if (buf == NULL) {
00916                 fprintf(stderr,
00917                         "error: get_param: allocating '%s' buffer: %s\n",
00918                         path, strerror(errno));
00919                 close(fd);
00920                 return -ENOMEM;
00921         }
00922 
00923         while (1) {
00924                 ssize_t count = read(fd, buf, page_size);
00925 
00926                 if (count == 0)
00927                         break;
00928                 if (count < 0) {
00929                         rc = -errno;
00930                         if (errno != EIO) {
00931                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: get_param: "
00932                                         "reading '%s': %s\n",
00933                                         param_name, strerror(errno));
00934                         }
00935                         break;
00936                 }
00937 
00938                 /* Print the output in the format path=value if the value does
00939                  * not contain a new line character and the output can fit in
00940                  * a single line, else print value on new line */
00941                 if (display_path) {
00942                         bool longbuf;
00943 
00944                         longbuf = strnchr(buf, count - 1, '\n') != NULL ||
00945                                           count + strlen(param_name) >= 80;
00946                         printf("%s=%s", param_name, longbuf ? "\n" : buf);
00947 
00948                         /* Make sure it doesn't print again while looping */
00949                         display_path = false;
00950 
00951                         if (!longbuf)
00952                                 continue;
00953                 }
00954 
00955                 if (fwrite(buf, 1, count, stdout) != count) {
00956                         rc = -errno;
00957                         fprintf(stderr,
00958                                 "error: get_param: write to stdout: %s\n",
00959                                 strerror(errno));
00960                         break;
00961                 }
00962         }
00963         close(fd);
00964         free(buf);
00965 
00966         return rc;
00967 }
00968 
00980 static int
00981 write_param(const char *path, const char *param_name, struct param_opts *popt,
00982             const char *value)
00983 {
00984         int fd, rc = 0;
00985         ssize_t count;
00986 
00987         if (value == NULL)
00988                 return -EINVAL;
00989 
00990         /* Write the new value to the file */
00991         fd = open(path, O_WRONLY);
00992         if (fd < 0) {
00993                 rc = -errno;
00994                 fprintf(stderr, "error: set_param: opening '%s': %s\n",
00995                         path, strerror(errno));
00996                 return rc;
00997         }
00998 
00999         count = write(fd, value, strlen(value));
01000         if (count < 0) {
01001                 rc = -errno;
01002                 if (errno != EIO) {
01003                         fprintf(stderr, "error: set_param: setting %s=%s: %s\n",
01004                                 path, value, strerror(errno));
01005                 }
01006         } else if (count < strlen(value)) { /* Truncate case */
01007                 rc = -EINVAL;
01008                 fprintf(stderr, "error: set_param: setting %s=%s: "
01009                         "wrote only %zd\n", path, value, count);
01010         } else if (popt->po_show_path) {
01011                 printf("%s=%s\n", param_name, value);
01012         }
01013         close(fd);
01014 
01015         return rc;
01016 }
01017 
01029 static int
01030 param_display(struct param_opts *popt, char *pattern, char *value,
01031               enum parameter_operation mode)
01032 {
01033         int dir_count = 0;
01034         char **dir_cache;
01035         glob_t paths;
01036         char *opname = parameter_opname[mode];
01037         int rc, i;
01038 
01039         rc = cfs_get_param_paths(&paths, "%s", pattern);
01040         if (rc != 0) {
01041                 rc = -errno;
01042                 if (!popt->po_recursive) {
01043                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: param_path '%s': %s\n",
01044                                 opname, pattern, strerror(errno));
01045                 }
01046                 return rc;
01047         }
01048 
01049         dir_cache = calloc(paths.gl_pathc, sizeof(char *));
01050         if (dir_cache == NULL) {
01051                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01052                 fprintf(stderr,
01053                         "error: %s: allocating '%s' dir_cache[%zd]: %s\n",
01054                         opname, pattern, paths.gl_pathc, strerror(-rc));
01055                 goto out_param;
01056         }
01057 
01058         for (i = 0; i < paths.gl_pathc; i++) {
01059                 char *param_name = NULL, *tmp;
01060                 char pathname[PATH_MAX];
01061                 struct stat st;
01062                 int rc2;
01063 
01064                 if (stat(paths.gl_pathv[i], &st) == -1) {
01065                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: stat '%s': %s\n",
01066                                 opname, paths.gl_pathv[i], strerror(errno));
01067                         if (rc == 0)
01068                                 rc = -errno;
01069                         continue;
01070                 }
01071 
01072                 if (popt->po_only_dir && !S_ISDIR(st.st_mode))
01073                         continue;
01074 
01075                 param_name = display_name(paths.gl_pathv[i], &st, popt);
01076                 if (param_name == NULL) {
01077                         fprintf(stderr,
01078                                 "error: %s: generating name for '%s': %s\n",
01079                                 opname, paths.gl_pathv[i], strerror(ENOMEM));
01080                         if (rc == 0)
01081                                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01082                         continue;
01083                 }
01084 
01099                 if (S_ISDIR(st.st_mode)) {
01100                         int j;
01101 
01102                         for (j = 0; j < dir_count; j++) {
01103                                 if (!strcmp(dir_cache[j], param_name))
01104                                         break;
01105                         }
01106                         if (j != dir_count) {
01107                                 free(param_name);
01108                                 param_name = NULL;
01109                                 continue;
01110                         }
01111                         dir_cache[dir_count++] = strdup(param_name);
01112                 }
01113 
01114                 switch (mode) {
01115                 case GET_PARAM:
01116                         /* Read the contents of file to stdout */
01117                         if (S_ISREG(st.st_mode))
01118                                 read_param(paths.gl_pathv[i], param_name, popt);
01119                         break;
01120                 case SET_PARAM:
01121                         if (S_ISREG(st.st_mode)) {
01122                                 rc2 = write_param(paths.gl_pathv[i],
01123                                                   param_name, popt, value);
01124                                 if (rc2 < 0 && rc == 0)
01125                                         rc = rc2;
01126                         }
01127                         break;
01128                 case LIST_PARAM:
01129                         if (popt->po_show_path)
01130                                 printf("%s\n", param_name);
01131                         break;
01132                 }
01133 
01134                 /* Only directories are searched recursively if
01135                  * requested by the user */
01136                 if (!S_ISDIR(st.st_mode) || !popt->po_recursive) {
01137                         free(param_name);
01138                         param_name = NULL;
01139                         continue;
01140                 }
01141 
01142                 /* Turn param_name into file path format */
01143                 rc2 = clean_path(popt, param_name);
01144                 if (rc2 < 0) {
01145                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cleaning '%s': %s\n",
01146                                 opname, param_name, strerror(-rc2));
01147                         free(param_name);
01148                         param_name = NULL;
01149                         if (rc == 0)
01150                                 rc = rc2;
01151                         continue;
01152                 }
01153 
01154                 /* Use param_name to grab subdirectory tree from full path */
01155                 tmp = strstr(paths.gl_pathv[i], param_name);
01156 
01157                 /* cleanup paramname now that we are done with it */
01158                 free(param_name);
01159                 param_name = NULL;
01160 
01161                 /* Shouldn't happen but just in case */
01162                 if (tmp == NULL) {
01163                         if (rc == 0)
01164                                 rc = -EINVAL;
01165                         continue;
01166                 }
01167 
01168                 rc2 = snprintf(pathname, sizeof(pathname), "%s/*", tmp);
01169                 if (rc2 < 0) {
01170                         /* snprintf() should never an error, and if it does
01171                          * there isn't much point trying to use fprintf() */
01172                         continue;
01173                 }
01174                 if (rc2 >= sizeof(pathname)) {
01175                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: overflow processing '%s'\n",
01176                                 opname, pathname);
01177                         if (rc == 0)
01178                                 rc = -EINVAL;
01179                         continue;
01180                 }
01181 
01182                 rc2 = param_display(popt, pathname, value, mode);
01183                 if (rc2 != 0 && rc2 != -ENOENT) {
01184                         /* errors will be printed by param_display() */
01185                         if (rc == 0)
01186                                 rc = rc2;
01187                         continue;
01188                 }
01189         }
01190 
01191         for (i = 0; i < dir_count; i++)
01192                 free(dir_cache[i]);
01193         free(dir_cache);
01194 out_param:
01195         cfs_free_param_data(&paths);
01196         return rc;
01197 }
01198 
01199 static int listparam_cmdline(int argc, char **argv, struct param_opts *popt)
01200 {
01201         int ch;
01202 
01203         popt->po_show_path = 1;
01204         popt->po_only_path = 1;
01205 
01206         while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "FRD")) != -1) {
01207                 switch (ch) {
01208                 case 'F':
01209                         popt->po_show_type = 1;
01210                         break;
01211                 case 'R':
01212                         popt->po_recursive = 1;
01213                         break;
01214                 case 'D':
01215                         popt->po_only_dir = 1;
01216                         break;
01217                 default:
01218                         return -1;
01219                 }
01220         }
01221 
01222         return optind;
01223 }
01224 
01225 int jt_lcfg_listparam(int argc, char **argv)
01226 {
01227         int rc = 0, index, i;
01228         struct param_opts popt;
01229         char *path;
01230 
01231         memset(&popt, 0, sizeof(popt));
01232         index = listparam_cmdline(argc, argv, &popt);
01233         if (index < 0 || index >= argc)
01234                 return CMD_HELP;
01235 
01236         for (i = index; i < argc; i++) {
01237                 int rc2;
01238 
01239                 path = argv[i];
01240 
01241                 rc2 = clean_path(&popt, path);
01242                 if (rc2 < 0) {
01243                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cleaning '%s': %s\n",
01244                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), path, strerror(-rc2));
01245                         if (rc == 0)
01246                                 rc = rc2;
01247                         continue;
01248                 }
01249 
01250                 rc2 = param_display(&popt, path, NULL, LIST_PARAM);
01251                 if (rc2 < 0) {
01252                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: listing '%s': %s\n",
01253                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), path, strerror(-rc2));
01254                         if (rc == 0)
01255                                 rc = rc2;
01256                         continue;
01257                 }
01258         }
01259 
01260         return rc;
01261 }
01262 
01263 static int getparam_cmdline(int argc, char **argv, struct param_opts *popt)
01264 {
01265         int ch;
01266 
01267         popt->po_show_path = 1;
01268 
01269         while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "FnNR")) != -1) {
01270                 switch (ch) {
01271                 case 'F':
01272                         popt->po_show_type = 1;
01273                         break;
01274                 case 'n':
01275                         popt->po_show_path = 0;
01276                         break;
01277                 case 'N':
01278                         popt->po_only_path = 1;
01279                         break;
01280                 case 'R':
01281                         popt->po_recursive = 1;
01282                         break;
01283                 default:
01284                         return -1;
01285                 }
01286         }
01287 
01288         return optind;
01289 }
01290 
01291 int jt_lcfg_getparam(int argc, char **argv)
01292 {
01293         int rc = 0, index, i;
01294         struct param_opts popt;
01295         char *path;
01296 
01297         memset(&popt, 0, sizeof(popt));
01298         index = getparam_cmdline(argc, argv, &popt);
01299         if (index < 0 || index >= argc)
01300                 return CMD_HELP;
01301 
01302         for (i = index; i < argc; i++) {
01303                 int rc2;
01304 
01305                 path = argv[i];
01306 
01307                 rc2 = clean_path(&popt, path);
01308                 if (rc2 < 0) {
01309                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cleaning '%s': %s\n",
01310                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), path, strerror(-rc2));
01311                         if (rc == 0)
01312                                 rc = rc2;
01313                         continue;
01314                 }
01315 
01316                 rc2 = param_display(&popt, path, NULL,
01317                                    popt.po_only_path ? LIST_PARAM : GET_PARAM);
01318                 if (rc2 < 0) {
01319                         if (rc == 0)
01320                                 rc = rc2;
01321                         continue;
01322                 }
01323         }
01324 
01325         return rc;
01326 }
01327 
01339 int jt_nodemap_info(int argc, char **argv)
01340 {
01341         const char              usage_str[] = "usage: nodemap_info "
01342                                               "[list|nodemap_name|all]\n";
01343         struct param_opts       popt;
01344         int                     rc = 0;
01345 
01346         memset(&popt, 0, sizeof(popt));
01347         popt.po_show_path = 1;
01348 
01349         if (argc > 2) {
01350                 fprintf(stderr, usage_str);
01351                 return -1;
01352         }
01353 
01354         if (argc == 1 || strcmp("list", argv[1]) == 0) {
01355                 popt.po_only_path = 1;
01356                 popt.po_only_dir = 1;
01357                 rc = param_display(&popt, "nodemap/*", NULL, LIST_PARAM);
01358         } else if (strcmp("all", argv[1]) == 0) {
01359                 rc = param_display(&popt, "nodemap/*/*", NULL, LIST_PARAM);
01360         } else {
01361                 char    pattern[PATH_MAX];
01362 
01363                 snprintf(pattern, sizeof(pattern), "nodemap/%s/*", argv[1]);
01364                 rc = param_display(&popt, pattern, NULL, LIST_PARAM);
01365                 if (rc == -ESRCH)
01366                         fprintf(stderr, "error: nodemap_info: cannot find"
01367                                         "nodemap %s\n", argv[1]);
01368         }
01369         return rc;
01370 }
01371 
01372 static int setparam_cmdline(int argc, char **argv, struct param_opts *popt)
01373 {
01374         int ch;
01375 
01376         popt->po_show_path = 1;
01377         popt->po_only_path = 0;
01378         popt->po_show_type = 0;
01379         popt->po_recursive = 0;
01380         popt->po_params2 = 0;
01381         popt->po_delete = 0;
01382 
01383         while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "nPd")) != -1) {
01384                 switch (ch) {
01385                 case 'n':
01386                         popt->po_show_path = 0;
01387                         break;
01388                 case 'P':
01389                         popt->po_params2 = 1;
01390                         break;
01391                 case 'd':
01392                         popt->po_delete = 1;
01393                         break;
01394                 default:
01395                         return -1;
01396                 }
01397         }
01398         return optind;
01399 }
01400 
01401 int jt_lcfg_setparam(int argc, char **argv)
01402 {
01403         int rc = 0, index, i;
01404         struct param_opts popt;
01405         char *path = NULL, *value = NULL;
01406 
01407         memset(&popt, 0, sizeof(popt));
01408         index = setparam_cmdline(argc, argv, &popt);
01409         if (index < 0 || index >= argc)
01410                 return CMD_HELP;
01411 
01412         if (popt.po_params2)
01413                 /* We can't delete parameters that were
01414                  * set with old conf_param interface */
01415                 return jt_lcfg_mgsparam2(argc, argv, &popt);
01416 
01417         for (i = index; i < argc; i++) {
01418                 int rc2;
01419                 path = NULL;
01420 
01421                 value = strchr(argv[i], '=');
01422                 if (value != NULL) {
01423                         /* format: set_param a=b */
01424                         *value = '\0';
01425                         value++;
01426                         path = argv[i];
01427                         if (*value == '\0') {
01428                                 fprintf(stderr,
01429                                         "error: %s: setting %s: no value\n",
01430                                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), path);
01431                                 if (rc == 0)
01432                                         rc = -EINVAL;
01433                                 continue;
01434                         }
01435                 } else {
01436                         /* format: set_param a b */
01437                         path = argv[i];
01438                         i++;
01439                         if (i >= argc) {
01440                                 fprintf(stderr,
01441                                         "error: %s: setting %s: no value\n",
01442                                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), path);
01443                                 if (rc == 0)
01444                                         rc = -EINVAL;
01445                                 break;
01446                         } else {
01447                                 value = argv[i];
01448                         }
01449                 }
01450 
01451                 rc2 = clean_path(&popt, path);
01452                 if (rc2 < 0) {
01453                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cleaning %s: %s\n",
01454                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), path, strerror(-rc2));
01455                         if (rc == 0)
01456                                 rc = rc2;
01457                         continue;
01458                 }
01459 
01460                 /* A value containing '=' is indicative of user error, e.g.:
01461                  *     lctl set_param param1 param2=value2
01462                  *     lctl set_param param1=param2=value2
01463                  */
01464                 if (strchr(value, '=') != NULL)
01465                         fprintf(stderr,
01466                                 "warning: %s: value '%s' contains '='\n",
01467                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), value);
01468 
01469                 rc2 = param_display(&popt, path, value, SET_PARAM);
01470                 if (rc == 0)
01471                         rc = rc2;
01472         }
01473 
01474         return rc;
01475 }
Generated on Sun Jun 5 20:54:45 2016 for Lustre by doxygen 1.6.1
